alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Mercer; Middlesex; Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and northern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey...Mercer. In northern New Jersey...Hunterdon, Middlesex, Morris, Somerset, Sussex, and Warren. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inches are possible across portions of the advised area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Brunswick, Morristown, Somerville, Somerset, Bridgewater, South Brunswick, Dover, Madison, Hopatcong, Middlesex, Princeton, and Florham Park. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 5 and 42. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 19 and 48. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 65 and 70. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 5 and 53. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
